I figured, he doesnâ€™t seem house trained, and it got so cold last night I imagine whoever owns him went to a warming station and couldnâ€™t bring him in. Iâ€™m not sure what to do with the guy

I havenâ€™t, he exhibits a lot of behaviors that people might consider aggressive, and Iâ€™m worried finding a person that wants to keep him may end up putting him back in the same spot. Iâ€™m weighing my options currently

Iâ€™ve seen him and his dog several times heading into the woods there (across the street from Freddyâ€™s), and also behind the old derelict pool at Underwood Park. Iâ€™m also not sure what to do with him, except maybe call the Humane Society or other dog rescues in town?

Two By Two is a great rescue!

Heâ€™s not scared of me a bit, and he was very standoffish early on especially when he met my other dog. He plays very rough, and seems like he has some extreme attachment issues, like he canâ€™t be left alone for more than a second. I know some people arenâ€™t really fans of that, and just handing him off wouldnâ€™t feel right
If it were up to me I would, but sadly itâ€™s not, so I canâ€™t. Iâ€™m just trying to find a home for him, or at least a chance at a home
Out of curiosity why not 2x2?

At least heâ€™s not super reactive. That would be much more hopeless. No expert by any means, but it sounds like a consistent routine and some basic behavioral training/socializing would do him wonders
Do you think hes ok with cats?

They are overcrowded, underfunded and understaffed and the staff they do have is untrained. I worked there and saw alot of good dogs linger and turn into complete wrecks behavioral wise and health wise, the whole places is worm central..
To be honest I wouldnâ€™t even attempt to put him around a cat. Heâ€™s very sweet but I doubt heâ€™s been around many cats, if any at all.

My pit acted just like this and she likes cats more than dogs (she was attacked about a year ago so that also adds to it). You'd be surprised at how many dogs actually do quite well with cats, but I totally understand the hesitation as you don't know this guy's history.
Thank you! I had no idea.
Damn, i want him but we got cats
I got cats once when I was in college, found out my significant other was getting to the pound with other people I didn't know about. Got a shot, cleared it up. Safety first! Cat free ever since.
you will have to teach him that cats are not bad
I like letting other people make contact with my cats, it makes me excited for them because they get to expirience the cats too
